description: [Status: stable] [Name: ellipsis-in-non-empty-class-body] [Message: Non-empty class body must not contain ...] What it does Removes ellipses (...) in otherwise non-empty class bodies. Why is this bad? An ellipsis in a class body is only necessary if the class body is otherwise empty. If the class body is non-empty, then the ellipsis is redundant. Example class Foo: ... value: int Use instead: class Foo: value: int
